text: This is a cool concept - Mexican express in a gas station. I'm addicted to their Chile Verde. Carnitas Burito is mucho delicioso!!! The poor guy is often alone - cooking, taking orders, cash register, packing to-go food..  but its definitely worth waiting! Towards the bathroom there's a funky seating with few tables, chairs, couch..even massage chairs and foot massagers while you wait for your food. Don't know what to say about this seating/waiting/dining area combo .......cute?  maybe convenient :)  Definitely my Mexican express!

BRUHHHHHHHHHHH

This place is the bomb diggity. One man show, my dude is taking orders, flipping tortillas, FaceTiming, and watching Espn deportes at the same time. 

I usually don't mind the 20-30 minute wait for my burrito but god damn it, it was well worth it. Probably the best Carne Asada I've ever had. Period. and this is coming from a guy who flew to San Francisco and UBERed to El Farrolito to get Carne Asada. That good, and this guy's shop is clean as hell.

You can never get a phone order in because this guy is running around all day 8-5pm. 

CARNE ASADA BURRITO no rice, no beans and sub them out for SOUR CREAM AND CHEESE, thank me later (no drake)

I'm hiring this dude to make tacos at my next birthday forreal..

Had my oil change done this morning at Choice gas station, and decided to have breakfast while my oil change was getting done. The place is call Chile verde, OMG!!
There chicken burrito is soooooo freaken good, way better than most taco shops. The place is very clean and the service was quick. By the time I was done with my food my oil change was done, Now that's service!! Before I took off I ordered another burrito to go since I enjoyed it so much.  I will definitely be back before my next oil change is due.

Great food and customer service food is delicious and always fresh red salsa spicy i usually get a carne asada burrito (huge) or adobada fries (super delicious and good amount) definitely worth every penny
I'm born and raised in San Diego, Cali. And all I got to say is that the food reminds me of home.

You wouldn't expect a great Mexican place to be located inside a gas station but hey, it must keep the costs low because you get a lot of great food for the buck! The first time I went thee I stood in line and the guy said "I heard this place was the best". Apparently word gets around! If you don't believe me then here are some facts that tell you why:

1) They only accept cash. That means they get enough biz not to care about accepting credit cards

2) I see the same clientele frequently (good repeat customers)

3) There is only ONE cook and he works hard and keeps his food consistent.

So the bad? Well, lunchtime can mean long waits because of number 3 above. They are not open on Sundays nor past 5pm. Sometimes they don't always open at 8am either... which means I can't get a breakkie burrito before work :(

Those things said, it's still a great place. Just try to hit it during the less busy times.
Super quick, always like to get mixed breakfast burrito.  Impressive how fast he can get these orders out.
Wait was long but the food is really good. And the portion and size is amazing.

The food was great! My problem was having to wait 20 minutes to order, completely being ignored while I was trying to ask for a fork and everyone else being served even though  I ordered first. IDK what Carlos problem was,  maybe over worked bc he was alone or he just didn't like me as a customer. Too bad, I love mexican food and would've been a regular customer in the future since I live just around the corner and hate too cook.
Best Tacos In Town And It's connected with a gas station and car wash 3 in 1

Carne Asada Super Nachos for $7.99 -- so good! Ingredients were fresh and lots of flavor. Huge portions of everything, especially meat. 

Cash only (no cards or checks). 

One person working (taking orders and making food). Went at 3:30pm and there was no wait. 

Seating -- some bar stools (6 maybe). I didn't see any tables though. 

Located inside the gas station.

Oh so good! Food was nice and hot, very flavorful, customer service with a smile. Their hot salsa is very spicy but addicting. Been here twice and the food takes a little longer but hey, it's not a fast food place, the food is really good and worth the wait over and over.  Visiting from California and decided future Las Vegas trips will never be complete without a stop at Chile Verde Mexican grill!

For anyone looking for a real authentic, Mexican food taste this is the spot,

Don't go to any of those other fake Mexican food places Roberto's or Don Tortaco which that place gave me the runs but that's another story,

This place is a one man band, and he doesn't disappoint on a busy you may get a delay on getting your food however it's well worth the wait,

If your impatient go to Taco Bell and enjoy fake crappy Mexican food,

I personally love the asada burrito, which the meat taste fantastic being born and raised in Los Angeles We have Mexican food places around every corner,

This place reminds me of back home,  I also tried asada fries they were amazing, but the gym hated me that night for them, lol  

For a great Mexican food taste eat at chile verde

This place is a hole in the wall place, but it is amazing! Our friends introduced us a few months ago and every time we come, we get the steak breakfast burrito and chicken tacos and they are perfect. They service is good and the place is clean. You won't be disappointed!

This place is awesome. It takes a little long to get your food but it's because it's fresh and hot and there's one guy doing it all. It's worth every second. I get my truck washed right there and sit down and have a great lunch that's hot and fresh. Compared to don tortaco or robertos......hands down wins over them every time.

Well deserved 5 stars. He has a passion for his food, and it shows in the quality. Fresh beans, yummy rice. Real corn and flour tortillas, meat tastes amazingly well seasoned and marinated to perfection. Today was huevos rancheras, and it was divine. You're doing great man, wait is well worth it for my belly to be this happy. Two thumbs up, I'll always be back.
I know what you're thinking....in a gas station??? Trust me it's the best in town! Fish tacos, adobada anything, breakfast burritos, and carne asada super nachos! All amazing!

My favorite Mexican food that I've found in Vegas! I've lived in San Francisco and Seattle so that's big competition. This guy works so hard and keeps his place so clean.  Check it out you won't be disappointed. My favorites are the super nachos and the carnitas chime chonga. Just got back from there to get my daughters birthday dinner. Asked her what she wanted and this was her pick!

True, the location is in a gas station/car wash; but don't hesitate for one minute, this location rivals any full service restaurant kitchen -Clean! Clean! Clean! The food is good authentic Mexican fast food, tacos, burritos, torts, nachos and more.  Six stools on a clean bar for a quick delicious meal while you get your car cleaned. Highly recommend it.
I attached a pic of the kitchen area for your scrutiny.

While I was getting my car washed I saw this little cafe inside the gas station convenience store. Originally I wasn't going to get anything but I'm sure glad I did. The carne asada burrito is incredible.
Great food good service, even tho you have to Wait for a lil but for your food but it is worth the wait I'm going to keep coming back, beat adobada tacos

Food is really good but the service is very slow. Owned by husband and wife but they should def hire another cook or employee. I had the enchiladas and chix hard tacos. Cant go wrong with those dishes. They have a large flatscreen tv which was cool cuz i was watching a playoff game and eating at the same time. Oh and its inside a gas station so u can easily get beer n other treats.

Ok so bad news first... It is a one man crew. He rings you up and he cooks. There are also LONG wait times because he is doing it all. Now on to the good news. IT IS WORTH THE WAIT! The food is AMAZING! Some of the best Mexican food I have had in Vegas or EVER. Better than Robertos. Better than most sit down restaurants. Plan accordingly so you don't upset yourself by the wait. Have patience and keep in the back of your mind that once you get this amazing dish it will become your newfound favorite. You will think about it every time you want Mexican food. That is why Chili Verde stands out among the rest.

This place is super authentic mexican, something I believe i know growing up in southern California...lol I understand cost and quality and this place is the joint. This place is a one man show, by the owner. Very friendly and kind. The only thing i did not give this place 5 stars is because sometimes there is a wait because its just him.
This is an awesome place to have quick freshly prepared Mexican food....Love their enchiladas...plus they're really reasonably priced....Will come here again... definitely...
Great food - good price. Some of the best in SW LV. It's a mom n pop place, so expect a Lil wait.

I would of never expected an awesome taco spot inside a gas station. This place is ran by one guy. A little bit of a wait but well worth it! Tried a burrito, carne asada fries and taquitos. All amazing! Will be going back soon!

Best chicken tacos I've ever had in my life. And I've had a lot of chicken tacos. The only negative thing,is the wait time. The owner works here and has no help. If like 5 people are already in line, it's going to be 30 minutes before you get fed. Honestly, it's worth it if you have the time.

The best Real Mexican Food in Vegas! This is not your organic California style Mexican food but real down to earth home cooked Mexican food that is amazing. the chicken chimichanga is to die for and the chili verde burrito will melt in your mouth. This place will have you coming back for more every week but be warned long lines form from 12-2 and sometimes you wait 30 minutes for your order but it is well worth the wait. Very clean, very fresh, and the best husband and wife team working to make this little grill the best in Vegas!

By far the best Mexican spot in Vegas. I've been trying to find one ever since I moved here from ca 4 years ago and I've finally found the best one! Had the super carne asada nachos, adobada mini taco, and chicken hard taco. 10/10!! I am very cautious of chicken tacos but holy moly that chicken hard taco was heaven! Definitely have to try! It's run by one man and I give him mad props. The food comes out slow, but everything is cook to order and comes out fresh by him. Worth the wait!! Trust me!
So fresh!!!  And just one dude back there cooking and taking orders - very impressive ... that guy was hustling!!  Would look forward to our next visit

This is an individual person inside a gas station pumping out big delicious plates of food for extremely reasonable prices. The counter top outside of his shop is a nice faux stone that makes the whole place feel more like home. There is one drawback: CASH ONLY! Dont catch yourself off guard and have to use the ATM for a $2.50 fee on a $4.50 burrito purchase. All prices include tax.
Best Mexican food around!!!!! Love everything I've tried. The price is great and everything is so fresh.
This is our favorite place in vegas. The salsa verde here is the best I've ever had. The atmosphere is great -- eating nachos while watching soccer. Can't be beat.

Dont judge a book by its cover. This place is great. Good quality, great value, and is easy in and out. It does take a little while compared to the fast food alternative but its worth it.
Had the carne asada fries. The portion was huge! I am no small man and I had plenty left over for a snack later. Quality is unreal. Well worth the trip.

Carlos is the one man running the show at this location and it's important for you to get to know him -- He is very kind and hooks people up all the time -- TIP HIS ASS! -- The only down side to this place is that their are only 5 stools to sit on -- It's more-so for carry out -- I'd highly suggest getting a carne asada burrito with carne asada, rice, and cheese only inside the burrito -- This place is 10x better than Roberto's and no where near as greasy -- I like to get the TROPICAL TEA from the gas station section it's right beside this place inside LOOK FOR IT

OMG ...this place gives Roberto's a run for their money and comes out on top in my book!  Amazing authentic Mexican food.  My husband picked it up so I didn't see the establishment, but he said it was located in a gas station and it was just one dude busting his butt whipping up mouthwatering tacos, burritos, etc.  Be advised:  CASH ONLY.  Also be advised, the food is addictive...just sayin'.  So worth it...

Carlos is a 1 man show , his culinary expertise delivers fresh Mexican food fresh ... Restaurant quality in a Gas Station .. Chille Relleno #1. My favorite dish , and I've tried plenty around the world , and Carlos's Relleno is hand made and cooked to perfection EVERY TIME. Consistent..

Don't judge a book by its cover...this place blows away don tortaco and roberto's any day. I was completely shocked by how good the food is. The chicken tacos come with double the meat than at roberto's, all ingredients are fresh and homemade. The chips in the super nachos are also made in house, makes all the difference!! The carne asada, tender and very flavorful. I guess they just have more attention to detail with flavors....All in all, for quick, great Mexican food, this is the place

I have found my new go to spot for quick and super delicious Mexican food! The food is absolutely mouth watering goodness! It is not greasy and generous portions of meat in the tacos. I have a weakness for carne asada fries and these are the best in Nevada! My only suggestion is that the business hours were open a little bit later.

The fish tacos are amazing! Chimichanga is the size of a football. Super nice hard working guy putting out legit
Mexican food. Can't get enough of this place! Try the chicken tacos too.

Wow! Very happy to have stopped here. Had the green chile plate and it was delicious. Tender pork, tangy and slightly spicy green sauce, giant flour tortilla made only seconds before, rice and beans for $8. Don't expect to get your food as quickly as you might at an average taco spot. It's a busy place and they put a lot of care into the food. Worth the wait.

The first time I had a Carne Asada burrito from Chile Verde was when my co worker brought one in for me.  After the first bite.... I knew this was the closest to authentic Mexican food that reminded me of home town LA!!!!

Since then, I've been coming to Chile Verde when we're on that side of town.  $6.95 for a Carne Asada burrito that is made fresh in front of my eyes and that Red hot sauce is to die for! literally!!

I am most impressed how it's usually a 1 man show!! For the most part, its 1 guy doing the ordering and the cooking, I'm assuming he is the owner!  Sometimes there's another person helping with the ordering.  I am also impressed at how clean everything is! the kitchen is open and it's very clean and organized!

Since it's usually just 1 person working.. the line can get pretty long and the wait for your order could be quite long too.  I wouldn't suggest coming if you're already frustrated and hangry.. but if you pull it together and try to be patient... it's worth every min!
I've been searching for some good carne asada tacos! The look is over! They are so delish
Great food at great prices!!!   Ordered a carne Asada burrito and quesadilla.  Both were huge and delicious.

I've been coming to Las Vegas for the last 20 years for the food.  Today I experienced some of the best Mexican I've I ever eaten in a little restaurant located inside a gas station.  I ordered hard shell, shredded beef tacos, cheese enchiladas, and a chile relleno.  The tacos were stuffed with shredded beef and cheese, the cheese enchiladas were loaded with cheese, and the chile relleno was one of the best I've ever had.
When I was there, it was a one man show, taking orders and doing all the cooking.  Patience pays off, the person preparing the food gives each order 100%.  The food was prepared with fresh, quality ingredients.  When ever I visit Las Vegas and want to eat Mexican food, this little restaurant will be my choice.

Best Mexican food in vegas! I come here at least once a week and it's always so delicious. The owner is great and works so hard and does all the cooking alone! ... It does take awhile to get the food but it's well worth the wait!
This one off the best Mexican restaurants in Las Vegas in my opinion. Great service and amazing food.
Carlos The Tacoman kills this spot.. Probably the best taco shop on the southwest side of town.. And it's in a gas station!!!

Who'd a thunk it to find a great Mexican spot inside a gas station?? But it was pretty legit for where it was.  And the ONE guy working the place was very friendly, FAST, and made yummy grub!  Their salsa was very tasty and you could tell it wasn't the canned or bottled crap.  They had a pretty wide selection of food, very impressed!

Carne Asada plate is amazing! The food is always fresh. The chips are really yummy made fresh for every order! Chicken tacos are to die for. This place is always busy but worth the wait. The passion that goes into the food is reflected in the food.

Are you kidding me!  Why haven't I been here before! Robertos tastes like old socks compared to this place.  Fifteen rolled tacos came to $12.75...and they were so bomb! Watched the cook make them fresh,  guac was fresh too.  The rolled tacos were absolutely delicious and not dripping with grease like other places I've been.  Kitchen was extremely clean and organized. It's located in a the convenience store of a gas station, but after trying it... who cares. Try it.

Terrible service. 
I ordered a bean and cheese burrito and told the lady thank you in Spanish. 
She then turned around to the cook and said I tried to order in Spanish. 
All of the customers that looked Hispanic where treated with the best customer service. 
I'm Hispanic but some people think I'm filipino and I get that a lot. 
Just wish my own culture would not make assumptions that I'm not Hispanic and don't speak the language.

This place is delicious! I used to come here aaaall the time when I was in high school. I've only ever seen one chef and he is great. I don't know how he does it. I'm really picky about my guacamole but it is perfect here. Everything is super fresh. I think it is better than similar places like Robertos or Faustos, which is kind of impressive considering it's just a small kitchen in the corner of gas station. The chile that they have is also great. The red sauce is nice and hot with great flavor!
I was really surprised at how good the food was. And it was just one guy working. The nachos are always a good choice.
Very upset. I went in today and they only accept cash. Come on! He pointed me to the ATM. I think not. I'm not using a high fee ATM for some food.
Carlos is the BEST! My family and I visit at least once a week. We have tried most of the menu items and they are all phenomenal!
Hands down the best fast food burrito in Vegas. I go there once a month. Every time I walk in the owner knows what I want and makes it to perfection every time. I highly recommend!

This place has the best Adobada tacos & burritos, i visit themq every other week and food has been the same. I get cravings. Its always packed with customers waiting and you can tell everyone enjoys the food here. 

They only accept cash. Ask for their hot sauce. Carlos is the best person that this business has been blessed with. Thank you Carlos for your 5 star service.
Great breakfast burritos! This guy kills it.. Car wash, gas, oil change and burrito!

We've been coming here since 2013, and always make the effort to visit whenever we're in town. I'm still blown away that a delicious Mexican restaurant can be found in a gas station miles away from the strip. It's a mom and pop business that serves fresh food at a really reasonable price. I'm amazed at how clean the kitchen is kept - makes me wonder how disgusting how other food joints must be behind closed doors.

We ordered 2 carne asada and 2 fish tacos and they were filled to the brimmed with protein (as we remembered it). Came up to $11 and we added a $2 tip - they really deserve it!

They are closed on Sundays so plan accordingly if you wish to try out their food!
Best burrito in the southwest/enterprise area. It is ran by one guy. He is fast and really clean.

I would never imagine getting freshly made burritos inside of a gas station? Best food decision I made today!!

It was the tail end of this employees day but you would never know it. We ordered two burritos (carne asada burrito and a Cali burrito) and got them pretty quickly since there were only a few people inside. The food was delicious!! And the salsa was also kind of amazing! He's truly a hard worker, friendly, and stays busy in between customers. 

I'll probably be back this week... :) glad I stopped in today!

I was dubious about a taco shop inside of a gas station, but, whoo boy!, I was surprised.  The place was extremely clean and the staff was friendly.  

But what takes the cake is the food.  I had their carnitas burrito.  It was stuffed with meat, beans, rice, guac and salsa.  The tortilla was warm and tasted like it was handmade; there was a perfect amount of rice in the burrito that it did not seem as though they were trying to save money by making a burrito made with filler.  

I will be back.

A one man operation. The guy that works here is the only employee so he knows what's going on! 

Great value and good food. Don't steer away because this is located inside the Sinclair gas station. 

I usually try to live by the motto: Don't fuel your body where you fuel your car.  This place is the exception to that rule. 

Thumbs up!

You really do find the best food in the unlikeliest of places. Case in point: this business is located inside of a gas station with minimal signage and puts out great food, to the extent that they often have a considerable wait.  Carlos' reputation for great cooking precedes him, and it's hard to have a conversation about the best burritos in Vegas without someone mentioning his spot by name. 

I've enjoyed both breakfast burritos and the namesake chile verde here, and I've not been disappointed. Prices are low, portions are huge, and the pork in particular is just so tender and flavorful! Unfortunately, half-hour waits have kept me from indulging as often as I want, as my schedule sometimes doesn't allow for me to wait. If you can, though, the food is definitely worth it. Be prepared to take your food to go, or pack up half of your remaining burrito after stuffing yourself at the dine-in counter!

Food is always consistently delicious...don't let the location fool you. Food is great and pricing is very reasonable..the nachos are a great choice meat is always cooked perfect and the portion is more than enough for two people!

I have no idea why Chili Verde's yelp rating is so high. After waiting in line for 10 min to place my order (with no one in front of me), he tells me it will be 25 min for my order because of another large order. Why couldn't he have said that when he saw me waiting??!!!! 

I must be a glutton for punishment. After my previous experience, I don't know why I decided to give them another try. Worst service ever!!! Unless you are willing to wait a ridiculous amount of time (and you won't be hungry for another two hours), don't bother coming here.

The first and obvious question about this place is: Why will I buy a Mexican food inside a gas station?

Why not?

Try the Chili Verde plate, especially the Chile Verde (making the 2014 Desert Companion list of Delicious Meal under $10), Carne Asada Fries and the Rolled Taco with Guacamole, and you will be a fan of this one-man-chef's cooking. 91.37% guaranteed.

Disclaimer: prepare to wait longer because of the solo service mentioned above.

If you're comfortable eating on the counter or on a bench outside while watching the car detailing, treat yourself casually with the experience. Did I not tell you this fast food is INSIDE the gas station? Or if you're like me, bring it at Exploration Peak Park. Enjoy!

Okay, listen this is a one man operation located in the Sinclair gas station. It's a small scale kitchen turning out mexican food that most fully equipped restaurants can't even dream of coming close to. The gas station itself is busy af. It's got a full service car wash and it's hectic. Add this guy and the many loyal customers that come in & out all day and you got a bit of chaos. 

So here's the breakdown: he takes orders at the register...3, 4, 5 at a time. Rings them up, takes your money, and then he goes and cooks everything and you wait. And wait. I have waited 40 minutes at some times...it gets very busy...you gotta be smart when choosing when to go. Do not go in there at peak times like lunch and think you're just gonna run in real quick. My husband gets angry during the wait. He says things like: 
This is ridiculous. 
It's not worth this wait. 
I'm never coming back. 
Then we get our food, he takes one bite and says things like:
This is the best burrito I've ever had. 
It's totally worth that wait. 
And I can't wait to go back.

So everything on his menu is delicious and our favorites include all the burritos but especially the California, the carne asada & the carnitas. We love the beef tacos and the adobada tacos. Yummy enchiladas and oh my husband ordered a carnitas quesadilla thinking he'd be able to eat that AND a burrito but the quesadilla turned out to be more than a meal! He had to save the burrito til the next day and it was delicious re-heated! 

When I first heard about this delicious Mexican eatery inside a gas station I promptly said no thanks. But people were buzzing about this place so we tried it. So thankful we did. It's really outstanding.

Let me get this out of the way first and the REAL reason why I gave this place a one star is, The lady at the cashier was not very customer service person. It honestly felt like she didn't care. I ALWAYS and always order a chorizo tacos from here it just honestly hit the spot for me, and this is pretty much my go-to place to have chorizo tacos. It's so good but yet she told me they never do that when I've gotten it pretty much every time. I couldn't believe it. I even showed her a picture of it that I got and even showed her on yelp that some other customer got as well and she said "no we don't do that. We do chorizo burrito but not tacos." Uhh??? Are you serious... I use to love this place when he was just a one man show but her added is a big Nono. Other than that I would give this place a five star.
Honestly as a former chef. This places is one of the hidden gems in Vegas. The food is some of the best I've had. And the prices are really affordable.

One word, AMAZING! 

Who knew such deliciousness existed inside of a gas station? 

This place definitely takes the cake! 

I walked in and there was only one guy working the grill. He took our order pretty quick and it was done in 10 minutes. I went with the nachos and my honey went with the chorizo tacos. The food is a few cents cheaper than your average Roberto's but way better quality. 

I had to steal a bite of the chorizo tacos and they are to die for! I had never tasted a better chorizo taco, not even in Mexico! My nachos were pretty good too. The guy makes the chips from scratch. When I was speaking to him he said everything was brought from California, even the meats, that's why the food tastes so much better, better ingredients. 

This place is only a few streets down from me so you can bet your shiny pennies that I'll be making it my mission to visit weekly.
I think this is the BEST fast food Mexican restaurant in Vegas. By far the best customer service. The food isn't greasy/oily like other restaurants. I love the fish tacos and breakfast burritos.

My co-workers have been frequenting this place for years and every time they go I hear them say, 'This place is the best!' Growing up in Southern California and traveling extensively in Mexico, I was always skeptical of a place of which I heard was housed in a gas station. I finally broke down today and had my co workers bring me some and oh....my....god. My mouth has never tasted such finery! I ordered what I thought would be a "safe" item for a first time order, the rolled tacos. Assuming I was going to get the standard skinny, tightly rolled, overly deep-fried, corn tortilla rolled taco, I was pleasantly surprised at what I saw. They were large, hand-rolled tacos in a lightly deep-fried tortilla. The toppings were generous and everything was fresh and hot. The chicken in each roll was of a generous portion and perfectly seasoned. Beware: The red salsa they serve here will light your tongue ablaze. Beware. The green salsa was more of a medium heat and very delicious. In the end, I bellied up and admitted to my co-workers that they were right along, this place is amazing. Honestly, I would eat this food from a back-alley grill if it always tastes this good. I highly recommend to anyone who finds themselves within 20 miles of this place, eat here.

Went to this place because of the reviews. Was looking for a good cheap Mexican place. $5 for 2 fish tacos and they were fresh and fast. I will def back! Yummmm

Went back for my second time. Tried ordering online. Do not order on the app! There aren't nearly as many options to add things or omit things as there are in the storefront. But yum yum their food is delicious and wonderfully flavorful and filling :)

Chile verde is awesome! A hidden gem inside choice gas station in the SW! Any1 that compares this place to Robertos or don tortaco is insane! Everything's made to order & fresh! I won't go to Robertos,fuestos etc anymore after coming here!

adobada super nachos were awesome. they use real tortilla chips. the red hot sauce has a nice chipotle, smokey flavor to them. make sure you dont come too hungry cause there can be a wait if there's a lot of people. great mom & pop restaurant.
We go to the gas station to get the mini carne asada tacos. The best street tacos around the southwest!

We were looking for a good to-go Mexican food restaurant seeing as Amigos had gone out of business, and Robertos was just not cutting it. We stumbled across this place on Yelp and was surprised to find out it was located within a gas station. We still ordered though, and to our surprise..... IT WAS THE BEST MEXICAN FOOD WE HAVE HAD IN LAS VEGAS. The chicken tacos are the best. The shell is the right combination of crispy and crunchy, and the taco isn't overly greasy like other places. Everything I have tried here has been absolutely delicious and not once have I had a bad meal. 

The only thing to be aware of is that there is only one guy working the whole area. So don't expect to be in and out within 5 mins. Everything is made when it is ordered, so it does take more time compared to a Robertos. But the extra time waited is definitely worth it!

Good mexican food, real fresh. I had the chicken chimichanga plate and my husband had the green chile verde plate.  The prices are pretty reasonalble too, our food came up to $14.00 something. There was only one guy cooking in there on a Saturday and it seemed really busy but we got our food in a reasonable time. I recommend it and will be back.

The tacos are great and the cook does an amazing job handling everything by himself. It does take a while to get the food but it's because there's just one person there. The hard chicken tacos are the best!
This little place inside a gas station is such a hidden gem! We love everything! Our favorite is the steak nachos. The red salsa is amazing!

Wait a minute I can get some good quick Mexican food from inside a gas station while I'm getting my car washed and it's not one of those big microwaved burritos!? Yes sir. 

Inside of the Sinclair Choice gas station you'll find Chile Verde Express a small restaurant serving up some quick Mexican food similar to those from Roberto's, Fausto's, Don Tortaco, etc. If you take a look at their pictures the items that stands out were the nachos and fries so of course I had to have one of them.  The carne asada fries was what I went with. Definitely one of the better I've had. I pretty much killed the entire container on my own in one sitting. I know I shouldn't have done it but it was one of those moments where I kept eating and eating and before I knew it they were all gone. I don't know what inside made it so good cause it looked like you typical carne asada fries.  It had a lot of fries, a lot of meat, a lot of quac, cheese, it was full loaded to hit me in the mouth. Maybe it was magic, they did take longer than expected. I haven't tried any of the other items yet but why would I want to. This is all I need why would I mess up a good thing. 

A few things about the place you want to remember when coming 1) It's cash only. Yea I don't know why businesses always do it. 2) It's not super fast but not super slow. Being that it's located at a gas station that also does full service car washes customers waiting might want to eat therefore a little waiting list. 3) Not really a place to dine unless you dont mind dining on a counter with a few stools in the middle of a gas.station. 

Other than that clean small place with a tv showing soccer. I'd be back for sure.
This is an awesome taco spot hidden inside choice gas station. Try the off menu Jose Loco Burrito(carne asada fries burrito).  Love love the food and service. They never disappoint!!!

Hands down BEST Mexican food. I've been coming here for years (since it opened) and the food has never disappointed! There's only one person working most of the time and a whole lot of people who want his food. So before coming, keep in mind that the wait might be a little long. Though you have to admit, this guy works pretty fast for having so many orders put in at the same time -- what's even more impressive is that all the food STILL ends up so delicious. The carne asada fries and carne asada nachos will always be my favorite and go-to foods, but I'm almost certain everything else on the menu is just as amazing. Definitely must try this place when you have the time!!!

Never in a million years would I think to find great Mexican food inside a gas station. However, I've always thought the best Mexican food are found at the cheap joints. It is rare that I like the fancy Americanized Mexican joints.

As far as food goes, it's the best that I've found in my neighborhood. I've ordered the mini carne asada tacos. He really hooked it up by giving 2-3 times the normal serving of meat, the chicken rolled tacos with guacamole are crack, & the carne asada nachos are large enough to share with 3-4 people. You might as well forget about your diet if you are ordering those nachos. Don't forget to top your food with the red hot sauce. It has a spicy kick to it.

I like the affordable prices, affordable for the average college student. Cleanliness is always welcomed and it's reassuring to see him washing his hands before each order.

The only cons that I can think of-Only one guy working and I wish they were open later on weekends. Even though he is fast, I think they can use one more employee during the busy meal times.

The best in town, the Chile Verde burrito is to die for... I brought my mom here today and she loved it too. This place packs out for lunch so bring your patience and the 2 that run the grill and the cash register are such hard working nice people, it's really great to see them succeeding in a small business.

Tried this place based on a friends recommendation and yelp reviews. This is a place that holds true to its reviews. It is located inside a gas station. The portions are huge and the food is delicious. We ordered carne asada nachos and chicken tortas. Both were amazing! I would definitely come here again! Move over Robertos. My new favorite mexican joint. Oh and the tortilla chips are the freshest I've ever had! They are cooked to order!! I don't know how many restaurants can say that.

I live in Mountains Edge and am always passing this area often driving to Rainbow/215. I'm a health nut and don't eat out often but love good Mexican food and tacos mainly. I have been trying to find a good go to spot on the SW for years as sadly the garbage late night hangover spots of all the Robertos and Don Tortaco type places in town are so gross. I get they are quick and convenient but between the rude despicable employees who despise their jobs and food that makes you feel sick the entire next day I had just given up on getting legit tacos and settled for Chipotle all these years. I'm so glad I randomly did a search on Yelp and ran across this place. I have been in this gas station so many times over theyears when mailing stuff to avoid the actual post office lol. 

I seriously can't even believe I passed this taco place every time as I just assumed it was   nothing special and mediocre food like everything else I had tried so far. Wow wish I had read reviews years ago. It is crazy to me how a place within a gas station can serve better quality Mexican food than any restaurant and other place I have tried on the SW. Owner is all about quality and between the Carne Asada tacos, Fries, Tortas, and Chicken anything I am blown away to how not only delicious but beyond fresh and quality every last thing is. I can understand why they have such a following as they beyond have a customer for life out of me if the quality stays this good. Simple enough but a rare thing in eating out in Vegas sadly. It is dangerous how often I pass this place and will be beyond tempted to stop everytime haha. Everyone should know about this grill as you will never go and newhere else hands down for the slop served elsewhere. The only thing I'm so bummed about is they close so early, at 5pm, which is literally the only downfall of this place for me and everyone who likes to grab food for dinner or at end of day in the way home! :) A++++

Seriously, there aren't many places in Vegas that have good Mexican food but I just love this place! The food is great every time and it's a great price. Yes it's in a gas station, but don't let that scare you. You might wait a little bit because there's only one person working but it's worth it and you'll appreciate how hard he works. He's seriously nonstop. Try the rolled tacos, they're super yummy and I'm trying the mixed breakfast burrito for the first time and it's tasty tasty!  enjoy!

I love this little place tucked away in a gas station/convenience store.  He's a one-man show, so sometimes it takes a few minutes to order, but then he prepares your order upon request.  I've had several different items over the years, and I always love the chicken nachos.  I get them with only chicken, tomatoes and cheese and they are delicious!  The portion is so large, it literally takes me 3 days to eat the whole order.  Everything tastes fresh and prepared to order as you like it.  Very reasonable prices too!
Don't let the fact this place is in a gas station fool you.  Extremely clean, and the food is fresh and good!  Nachos are amazing.  The main guy that works is fast and nice.

Let me tell you something OK.  I am from East coast DC area and everytime I come visit my in laws in Vegas I come to this little gem.  Sometimes I got to stand and wait to order cause only one guy cooking but it's worth the wait any day.  I usually just have steak tacos.  There hot sauce is on fire!! It's the best. This place very clean too.. a plus :)

Love this place! It's a one man show, he's super quick. The food was beyond our expectations. The carne asada tacos and quesadillas were great. Portions are huge and the prices are cheap. Highly recommend.

Amazing place, where the kitchen takes real pride in their food... I love a place where you can  tell it is locally-owned and the regulars are respected.  The food is amazing and they will customize almost anything just ask!
Love this little hole in the wall in place. I got the super nachos and the chips were homemade and crispy. Best Mexican place so far in Vegas. Will definitely be back.

So happy to find this gem in my neighborhood! Came here because of the good reviews and photos... Ordered the Carne Asada Super nachos and the Chorizo combination plate -- and left thoroughly satisfied!

Who would have thought great food could be found inside a gas station!? I've heard many great things about this place so I had to try and it did not disappoint. The food is great, everything is prepared fresh and right in front of you. It's pretty amazing it is all done by one guy who runs the place solo. It takes a bit to place the order/ get it but it's worth it!

This place is so good! I prefer to go in the mornings as it is a one man shop and the wait can be quite long but his carne asada fries are the ****.  His carne asada burrito is good too but I forgot to say no guacamole which was my fault

The food is cheap and delicious. I've lived in San Diego for the past 6 years and took my easy access to cheap and delicious Mexican food for granted. We bought burritos and rolled tacos. The rolled tacos were better than most I have had in San Diego. There were two people working when I visited so the wait wasn't too long. Less than 10 minutes. BRING CASH!!!!! I read the reviews online to bring cash which I did not have. I thought it would be easy to get cash back at the gas station the restaurant is inside but it was a pain. They charge a fee to get cash back and a fee to use a debit card.

Yes yes. It's slow to get your order but that's because it's usually just one man running around like mad! He preps and makes everything and sometimes has help ringing orders. But the food is well worth the wait! Best part is if you go order and then get your car washed/detailed (you have the option of them filling your tank or repairing glass chips) this place is a one stop shop!! His nachos are bomb. The fish tacos are to die for fresh. Even just getting a few mini tacos can fill you up and make you oh so happy! His red hot sauce is flaming hot and his verde salsa is oh so good!

THE BEST TACOS!!! If they had a restaurant it would kill!! You seriously can't get tacos like this anywhere else in Vegas. I just got back from Mexico and had tacos everyday, I kid you not, none of them were as good as these. The carne Asada is so tender and the flavor is unexplainable. If you can put it past that you're getting food at a gas station then you've just rewarded yourself a little bit of heaven. I hope they have these in Heaven 
Ps: Don't forget to bring cash, they don't accept card

I have had the tacos and they are great, not to mention they are huge! I also got chips and quac and the taste was good. Portion for the quac was on the small side and would probably not order again. Chips were fresh and would definitely order again.

We had our doubts because it's at a gas station but decided to give this place a try

Super glad we did

We had a adobada burrito and the Chile relleno and enchilada combo plate 

Burrito was pretty good sized 

But the stars were definitely the Chile relleno and enchilada . Cheesy goodness  The Chile relleno actually still had Chile - not all bread. 

Their salsa is actually good to. They have green (mild) or red (hot).

Would definitely come back

I would give him 5 stars but he forgot my tostada 
Besides that he is always friendly, and food is ALWAYS fresh, awesome price and quality especially for such a small operation

Had to try this place out because of the good reviews. Ordered the "Super Nachos" w/ chicken, carne asada burrito, and of course their fish tacos. Fish tacos are one of my all-time favorite foods and I order them everywhere .. and I gotta say their's are very good. And oh man, they put 2 HUGE pieces of fish in each taco. Delicious. As for the nachos, they were okay but I found the chicken a little dry .. maybe try a different meat on those next time. The burrito was quite tasty as well and also on the large side. Good mexican food, good service. And you can get your car cleaned while you eat!

I have been to this place twice. The first time no one even acknowledged me at the register so I left. The second time I actually ordered and then was told they only take cash. Honest to God. Bring cash if you want to eat here. I haven't been able to eat here yet.

The lady attending cash register and taking orders extremely rude. Food is good but she needs to work on her customer service to keep people coming back. Every time I go she says it's a 30 minute wait.
This is a wonderful little mexican restaurant!  All of the food is cooked fresh to order and is very tasty!  I am a true fan!

I never ever, EVER thought I would type the words I am about to type.

I just found a place that is going to replace Don Tortaco! It is not only better, it is a LOT better! 

This awesome gem is located inside the Sinclair Choice convenience store on the northwest corner of Windmill and Rainbow. At first glance it certainly doesn't look like much. It's actually just off in a corner of the store across from the cashier. 

This morning I finally had a chance to check it out for myself. The do have a little seating area with a few stools, while a flat screen TV plays ESPN nearby. I opted for my usual breakfast burrito while my friend opted for a carne asada burrito. 

The prices are similar to Don Tortaco. The healthy sized portions are similar to Don Tortaco. The difference here is the quality of the food! Much tastier and, more importantly, not nearly as greasy as Don Tortaco! Seriously, I was amazed at how tasty my burrito was! I also love the fact that you can watch the guy cook up your order as you take a seat on the stool.

Service was quick and friendly, so no complaints there.

I am most certainly in a lot of trouble. With a place like this being so close to the house, I can see myself coming here quite often!


4 stars.
Had a carne Asada burrito which was huge and flavorful. Will definitely be going back. Service was pretty quick
This place is a gold mine...as good as cheap Mexican food served in a gas station can get. A strong Hispanic following is noticeable which means a lot.

It is true when they say the best Mexican food comes from places that used to be radiator shops. Who would have known that the  inside of this gas station holds wonders your mouth has only tasted in dreams? 

I have had a few things from here and everything I've had the pleasure of tasting thus far has exceeded my expectation. 

The nachos are surely supreme. It's nice to go somewhere that actually gives you enough toppings for every chip. Their guacamole is rich and creamy, their carne asada is flavorful and bold, and their red salsa...*melts* is so spicy it makes you sweat. (Of course there's green tomatillo salsa if you like the flavors within the heat) 

My favorite thing to order is the machaca burrito with extra cheese. It hits every spot. My co-workers can vouch for all the other breakfast burritos and while I was there the chorizo and ham seemed to be extremely popular. I'm more of a bacon girl myself. 

This is a must try! I can't wait to try even more from their menu.

It's a one man show for sure. The lady who must be the owner is not made to work in the restaurant. She is slow and prefers to interact with Spanish people only. Their food is made first for example I have been waiting for my food for 20mins yet the person who ordered and payed after me has already left the building. The food might be good but the service and customer service sucks
Best Mexican food in town. You wouldn't think that such a great place could be in a random gas station. The burritos and salsa are the bomb.

**** Alert! Alert! ---- Mexican Ninjas Invade Choice Gas Station !!!! *****************

A Mexican ninja who goes by the name of Carlos is a one man show a la Magic, a la Lebron.  He takes the orders, preps/cleans when no one is there, chops, cooks, rolls, serves - the one man ninja does it all with SPEED, EFFICIENCY, and CONSISTENCY!

I never seen a cook work so fast and deliver stellar, authentic, home cooken Mexican fast food.   We walked up to the counter and didn't see the bell by the register so stood for a few minutes while Carlos was in the back being his ninja master self.  He arrived back and showed us the bell - now we know...hah

We asked him what's good......the asada, burritos, fajitas to which he replied, "everything....everything fresh"   I asked a follow up question and was cut off with the same reply.   Carlos wasn't going to budge and after ordering a chile verde and asada combination plate, and a fresh order of tortilla chips and salsa i know why.......Everything here is the sh1t!   

What I like most about this set up is that you can watch how it all unfolds.  Nothing is hidden.  You'll see all his tricks if you can keep up.   Order with confidence and you'll be granted a quick, fast, homemade meal that's better than any fast food mexican in vegas and rivals most sit down restaurants.

Best Mexican "fast food" in town. It's inside a gas station, so it's very unexpected but it doesn't disappoint. I can honestly say his food is better than most sit down Mexican restaurants. It's a one man band so expect a long wait during morning rush and lunch rush. He usually closes at 3:30 (not 5:00 pm)
Sooooo goooooood! I love getting my car washed and eating! It's cash only. One man show! Chicken burrito is great, chips are fresh and not greasy, guac is amazing!

I did my research and read the reviews, and everyone is right on par with the wait times, it's just one lone guy working the kitchen and the register. (Around lunch hour, usually someone else shows up to run the register but not cook). I ordered the chicken tacos, carne asada taco and breakfast burrito. All were delish but the burrito was a little of a disappointment, I asked for everything except ham, and wouldn't ya know there was ham in it. 

This place would kill it if they had online ordering that automatically gave estimated wait times based on ordering ques.

Good food but the slowest service ever! Only because it's one-man ran. It's always busy during the day there with little room and no parking, it can be better organized. I would go all the time if it didn't take so long.
So good. So fast! Biggest burritos ever! I got the California Burrito and an order of 3 taquitos. Both were very fantastic. Gracias!

Yep call me crazy, but I took a chance and ate Mexican cuisine at a gas station. And it was good! Besides having dinner at a Mexican friend's home, this was as close to homemade as you can get. The prices are reasonable and the portions are plentiful. We had the carnitas plate. The pork was perfect and the accompaniments, rice, beans and salad were equally delicious.

Wanted to check this place out ever since I went in to pay for gas but never had time to stop in and order food. I finally made the stop specifically to try the food with such high reviews. Unfortunately the service leaves much to be desired. There was only one guy behind the counter and after he served the two people at the counter he didn't look my way or acknowledge me in any way. Still I gave him the benefit of the doubt and waited...and waited some more. Nope I had to leave. My meal was not going to be free, no handouts, so I expect to be acknowledged and served. I took my money and my business elsewhere. I will not be back.

People kept telling me about this place and I NEVER THOUGHT would say BOMB TACOS AND NACHOS FOR SURE...in a gas station?! But YES - THEY ARE AMAZING! 

Went there for the oil change free car wash deal and decided to get the carne asada nachos while I waited..I am now super addicted. I never buy food in a gas station either but I kept hearing this was where to go (pictures on yelp sold me). Little bit of a wait since it was just one guy on the grill but wow was it worth it.

Chips so good & the carne had great flavor. Just had to write a review and noticed others saying it was better than Robertos - which i agree. I must not be alone...when I turned around with my food,I realized three people were ordering take out for their families...it says a lot when a person stops at a gas station and orders to go in my opinion it confirms it is good.

Mini tacos are $1.50 and they are great. Meat is fresh and moist, tortillas are soft. I'm taking a star off for the hours. They close at either 6pm or 7pm every day. That's super early for a taco place to close. But it seems he works alone so if that's the case I can understand the hours.

I absolutely love the food they serve. Fresh ingredients are hard to find these days. I've been going to them for as long as they opened. I visit them at least once a week to get my pork tacos. The best in the city!

This our very first time here. We were craving mexican food and checked out yelp. There were HIGH recommendations at this restaurant. We ordered Beef Enchiladas and Carne Asada nachos. This is a GREAT place for Mexican Food.......very limited seating.
Will be back here ASAP.........to try other items on menu.........

Patience is a virtue. If you are willing to be patient and wait 15-20 min for your food, you will experience some of the BEST Mexican food in all of Las Vegas. Don't let the gas station thing fool you. This guy is a magician in the kitchen. He is left by himself for most of the day. He has to take orders, cook and clean all by himself. So don't be mad if it takes a bit to get your food. 

The Chile Verde plate is one of the best Mexican dishes I've ever had in my LIFE. An absolute must try.

The worst thing a business can do is not stay open during  stated business hours. I want to support local business and small business as much as I can. But not at the expense of wasting my time. It is like saying you do not need my business. Here is my review: return customer as the food is good. Lost as a customer due to not needing my business. Bye bye.

One man working crew, always busy and had his hands full. You can tell he works very hard! Does seem odd that it is in a gas station although this place never seems to disappoint. Love the carne asada burrito and the breakfast burrito. Very clean, we also appreciate the open view to the kitchen and food making process, this guy is great!

Very good food but the 25 minutes for a simple burrito was abhorrent.  It's only one person there so he is very bogged down with orders.  It took me 14 minutes before he could even take my order.  Think smart, hire someone else and you would be able to do many many more orders.  I will never come back simply because of the ridiculous wait.

Not sure what the big whoop us..It was ok. We had cal burrito..it had plenty of chicken..really bland.they give you a little plastic container of sauce you can add later but flavor isn't cooked in. It had no beans..no rice..no lettuce..no guacamole..a small amt of cheese...and a dab of what I guess was salsa..again bland.  The size waa ok but for $8 expected more.  Was disappointed no guac inside.  Not sure what they think made it a calif burrito?  It was just chicken.  The service was ok it wasn't too busy so took about 10-15 minutes w 2 others ahead.  We might go back if in a pinch, we live around the corner so I was hoping it was better ..we would've been there all the time.  Oh well.

You've all heard about the dangers of "gas station sushi" but in this case, gas station/car wash Mexican food is probably the best in Las Vegas.  A chef and manager efficiently turn out terrific Mexican favorites, all at a reasonable price.  While they only have a dozen stools, they do take out, too.  Not a romantic spot for a date, but you will fall in love with their food!   We had the chorizo plate and the carnitas plate, both served with rice and refried beans and choice of steaming corn or flour tortillas.  (both $8.95).  The sauces and flavors were authentic and savory.  Can't wait to go back...maybe the next time I need a car wash!

I'm really torn. The food is amazing, but the service sucks. I've been here on multiple occasions and it's the same every time! I don't know if it's because I'm not a close personal friend of the gentleman who runs it or because I don't speak Spanish. My wife and I waited about 10 minutes for him to finish up preparing orders that had already been put in, but also for orders being shouted over the counter in Spanish from people who came in after us. When we finally did put our order in he also took the orders of four other people after us, and filled their orders first! So we were the last ones standing to get our order and I'll tell you the food is fantastic! But the service sucks! If you have patience and don't mind getting your order skipped repeatedly this is a fantastic place to eat, but I think this was the last straw for me. I'll spend my money and time where it's appreciated...
Best Mexican food especially because he cooks the meat fresh every time but he closes whenever he wants so I make empty trips on a regular basis. Thanks!

After reading such great reviews on yelp, I've been wanting to try this place! My first attempt was a disappointment because I showed up at around 5:45pm on a Sunday and it was closed. Although frustrated, I couldn't get too upset since it is a one man show and I'm sure he'd like to get home to his family at some point. 
My next attempt was around 7pm on a Tuesday evening. Ordered food to go for the entire family and sat and waited for it with my oldest son. 

Was super impressed by the process this gentleman has making all of the food. After cooking the meat and filling two carne asada tacos, he added more to the grill and stuffed those tacos to the gill!! My oldest son who refuses to eat carnitas from any place but home, ordered two mini carnitas tacos and absolutely loved them!! 

Overall the entire family loved what they ordered. It's cheaper than a Don Tor Taco or Roberto's and the food is so much better! We will definitely be returning to help support this gentleman's business and enjoy some delicious homemade Mexican food!
These guys need to get with the 21st century. The food is super tasty. But they run out of things too soon and ONLY TAKE CASH. So disappointing when I'm stuck going to to robertos.

He is always very busy but let me tell you!!  It's worth the wait I drive from the other side of town most of the time to get here because I crave it so much. Delicious tortillas and very tasty meat, beans and rice are authentic, and the the salsas are perfect. That's all you need to know

You would think a place with the word Express in the name would be quick. You would be wrong! ... that being said, it is so worth the wait! Best chicken tacos I've ever had and I loved their hot sauce! Looks like he is generous with meat on everything he makes. Can't wait to go back and try different things! This place is NOT close to my house and I'll probably still be a regular now.

Here's the deal. Good tasting food. I have officially tried several items and it is always delicious and consistent. Who would have known, that the best Mexican food joint in my area is in a gas station. Two workers, lady and man, always the same, and they know that these 'pop-up' Mexican franchise joints on every corner are ripping the public off, with awful fast Mexican food. This place will give you quality for same prices as these so called big franchises. Only con is, sometimes busy, but worth wait. And it's a m-f open only, no late night and no 24 hour.

Yes, in a gas station. To be fair it's quite a snazzy gas station, the kind with a full service car wash with people hand waxing and such. Chicken is light and fluffy with no fat or bones. Chips are the deep fried semi-greasy kind but that's my only gripe. All Ingredients are fresh light and not too spicy or too greasy. 1st visit we had the super nachos w chicken and two cheese enchilada combo meal. Delicious!

I wouldn't say it's the best burrito I've had but I have had worse! The place is clean an don't let the whole gas station thing scare you, it's all good. All the ingredients seem to be fresh and the  asada was good, there just seemed to be something missing ... That pizaz, the bannng, the boom? For a quick fix, it'll do.... Plus I can almost walk there !

What an awesome little hidden gem inside of a gas station. Yes, you totally wouldn't expect a joint such as this at a gas station to serve such good food like Chile Verde does, but you are in for a surprise. Plus, you can't really see their signage since it's on the same one as the gas station prices, but I guess they get all their business through word of mouth and of course Yelp. Our church group uses this gas station for our fireworks booth and 2 years ago when we first did it I didn't really pay much attention to them. Now that I read all these awesome reviews I definitely had to try them out. During our 6 days we were there I tried them 2 times and they certainly did not disappoint! The first time I had the nachos with beef and everyone is right the tortilla chips are made fresh and they are delicious. Unlike, Roberto's who has dry nachos and carne asada, their version of beef nachos was certainly not dry but had some moisture to them. I'm glad I asked for my beans on the side because it would of ruined the awesome texture of the fresh tortilla chips. The second time I ordered the California burrito, which was priced at around $5. This burrito was huge! At other places they would probably price it at $6 or $7 which makes Chile Verde affordable. I bet 2 people with smaller appetites could share that burrito because I could only eat 3/4 and let me tell you I am an eater. The inside of the burrito had fries and beef with salsa. Pretty delicious I must say. My only major gripe is that the owner is a 1 man show! He is the cashier, the cook, the expediter, everything! I know he is probably doing that to reduce costs and keep prices low, but man the wait time is rather long just like everyone says. Both times I was there, he was super busy. Although the second time the food came our faster than the first. The first time I think I waited a good 15 minutes. If only I lived in this area, but I guess this joint adds on to the foodie spots on Rainbow Blvd/South West area. The chimichanga looks good and I will order that next time I'm here. Chile Verde is definitely a step up above Roberto's and if you're in the area craving Mexican food, definitely hit Chile Verde up!
closest place in Vegas that reminds me of authentic Mexican food from the Bay Area...Carlos is a one man crew..no wonder the food always stays consistent!

Not sure about the wait everyone is referring to.  Yes there is only one cook and one FOH person but I've never had to wait longer than 10 minutes.  The food here is good (way better than the other "authentic" Mexican places).  Wish they took credit/debit card here but it's not the biggest deal.  Always soccer on the TV to watch!  I will continue to come back to this place over Roberto's/Don Tortaco/Fausto's/etc.

Bomb nachos.  
one man show.  
Inside the gas station!
Expect a wait

Burritos and the chips are amazingly awesome. Saw one customer that was complaining because the chef told him he could only accept cash at the moment and it was closed for a moment, the customer was also mad because his kids were hungry. To that customer, there are tons of places to elsewhere. If you were so concerned of your children being hungry, maybe take them somewhere else to eat instead of complaining and posting it on fb/yelp. Are you really that lazy to walk a block to find foods? Anyways, foods and service is awesome! Keep it up!!!

I LOVE this place!
The food is really good and fresh, everything is clean.
Carlos the owner is so nice, always smiling and happy to see me , he remember what I like to order and this is why I always coming back.

I found him on Yelp 2 month ago and since than I am coming minimum once a week.
Keep doing the good work!!!

Food here is just delicious  everything is made fresh and it's an open kitchen so you can see how clean it is. There is always so many people here but that is because the food is great. Carlos is the cook here and he's by himself he's pretty fast and his wife helps him out taking people's orders. They're both so friendly and have a good sense of humor. I really recommend everyone trying this place out !
Deleted.  Outdated. 5+ years.  Will go back.  Could be better. We'll see soon.  Maybe tomorrow.
The best fish tacos in Las Vegas! As authentic as it gets.  The staff is very friendly, the prices are the best in town, and the status man is very clean and well kept.

Amazing.  I am liking this.. corner.

Ive been trying several new Mexican spots around this area recently, and by far this tops them all.   It's a one man show, and he has a respectable size menu to show off too.  I didn't know what i really wanted at first, so i settled with the Asada Burrito.  And I'm glad i did.  The steak tasted fresh.  I didn't pick the meat apart to taste the seasoning like i normally would because i was already enjoying it.  It was that good with all the works; beans, lettuce, diced tomatoes, rice, and guacamole.  Pick it up a notch and add some of that red hot sauce.   WOOoo!

2nd time I came around to try their Chili Verde Burrito.  Slow roasted pork shoulder with bean and cheese.  The pork i could tell was made with extra care as it was extraordinary tender.  Again, i screwed up and didn't pick apart the burrito for some more refine tasting.  I went straight for what i know was good, the red hot sauce, and went into town.  This guy sure knows how to make a good burrito!

I personally like the Asada better, but that's because i prefer steak over pork.  But in all honesty you can't go wrong with either.  They're both great.  Can't wait to come back and try some other stuff.  Couple more recon and this may potentially be my fav around the SW area.

Hours are nonexistent, so be sure to come in at reasonable hours.

This is hands down the BEST Authentic Mexican food I have ever eaten! It was so fresh and flavorful. I got the two chicken taco combo, and it definitely killed Roberto's tacos. The shells were fried to perfection. Also the rice was legit wet Mexican rice. Not the dry rice you get everywhere else. This place cooks to order so expect a little wait, but it's definitely worth it! It's also in a gas station so it only offers bar-style seating or take-out. This is a hidden gem on the southwest side, I highly recommend trying them!

My husband had his car smogged and went in to order the asada nachos and 2 fish tacos.  Food was very good.  Tacos were huge.  He told me how the guy was speedy on the grill, taking orders and packing it up.  I would definitely get food from there again.

THIS IS OFFICIALLY MY FAVORITE MEXICAN FOOD PLACE EVER. California burrito is amazing. Breakfast burritos are just as good. Chile Verde burrito is great and full of flavor. Can't go wrong with carne asada fries or nachos. It's just one guy cooking/running the show, so be patient. It's worth it. Cash only though. Get a car wash, enjoy a burrito. Rinse and repeat.

this place is legit!!! probably the best Mexican food I've ever had.  tried the carne asada burrito and adobada burrito. they were both excellent but if I had to choose I'd say the carne asada wins in a close one. I highly recommend this place who wants freshly made and very delicious food. Can't miss. will be back to try rest of menu.

Wow, I must say 5stars plus! This place is in gas station/car wash. Was waiting for car to be cleaned figure I grab some tacos while waiting. $2.50 each plus Jamaica hibiscus drink. Total $6.75. Cheap! And REALLY GOOD!! There's only one person working behind counter but he's does a kick ass job! So be patient. 
And here's the best part...the guy washed his hands after every time he use cash register and then put on gloves before he touched any food!! Health department should give this guy 2 AA's for that. I think I just found my new place to grab some good tacos! Tip the guy few bucks, he deserves it!!

My boyfriend has been raving about this taco spot for sometime now and I finally got the chance to give it a try! This location is inside a gas station of all places but don't let that discourage you. They make all of your favorite Mexican dishes from breakfast burritos, tacos, enchiladas, quesadillas etc. but they are known for their carne asada! We ordered the carne asada nachos and tacos. The wait is pretty lengthy but it's so worth it. It's only one cook/cashier (I think it's a family owned establishment) he does everything super quick but cooked to perfection! The carne asada was super tender, tomatoes and limes, cheese were fresh, corn tortillas and nacho chips were also fresh! The only thing I have to say is that this place deserves a location on its own. We will definitely be coming back!

This place is TOO GOOD. How can this little grill in the corner of a quick-stop/gas station/car wash be THIS GOOD? There are proper restos that can't put out what this one cook delivers. I sure wish they had several cooks (as do other patrons, by their reviews), but the quality and flavor are worth the minor challenges. Wish I discovered it sooner, but it's on the map now!

Just bring your hungry and your patience, and check the hours.

I'm not big on using hyperbole, but I can honestly say this is the best burrito Ive eaten that came from a gas station! Ok, all kidding aside, this is a legit taqueria. My adobado burrito was big enough that I felt like it was a good value for the $5.75 I paid, but not so big that I feel uncomfortable afterwards. They also get points for NOT filling their burrito with lettuce (every bite you take WILL be Mexican goodness). Lesson of the day: don't judge a burrito joint by its physical premise.

I have been coming here since they opened years ago and Carlos has never disappointed. Whatever I order and I've tried it all, its freshly made. No other mexican fast food compares. The meat in the carne asada is not fatty or grizzly. Everything is flavorful and the pico de gallo is fresh. Anything fried is crispy and not oily. 
And today they accept credit cards
As busy as they get, he has never gotten my order wrong. For sure there is a long wait to order and receive your food, but I just plan for that when I come and enjoy my food.
This place was delicious my boss totally hit the spot with this place. Never thought I'd get such a bomb burrito from a gas station. I guess anything can happen in Vegas!
If you can wait unnoticed and don't mind paying only in cash, this is by far the best Mexican place in town. This is the place for foods after all. Not for service. Not for your convenience.

PLEEEEEEEEASE PLEEEEEEEEEEASE HIRE MORE PEOPLE!

I really want to eat the carnitas tacos on a weekly basis but I CANNOT wait in line for 30 min to an hour every time. 

At least one more employee would be great, please. *prayer hands*
Order Fish taco and Mineragua it so good  this place is inside gas station Choice. Best taco place here in southwest.

Talk about ambiance, this micro-sized restaurant is located inside the convenience store at a Choice gas station.  There were but 2 employees, one on the grill working his tail off and a laid back counter person taking orders.  Most orders were to go, but we consumed our meal at the 5-6 seat counter.  We each chose a pair of mini (street) adobada tacos that were amply filled with spicy meat though the could have been a notch better served with crema.  I had to pay for our beverage separately from the cashier for the gas station/mini market.
I love it great Mexican Food I go there all the time if you havent been there you need to go there ASAP
Great spot!! Who would of thought of good food at a gas station!! Real Mexican, Real Authentic!!
This place is the best , a little far from where I live but worth the drive, I always order the chorizo tacos, make sure you bring cash because they don't take cards.

My family and I go here at least once a week! I am not kidding when I say this is the BEST mexican food in Vegas. We are from San Diego and it was difficult to find delicious authentic mexican food similar to home. But this place not only achieves that, but exceeds expectations. breakfast burritos are amazing, salsa is great, i love the green. Careful red is very hot but also good. The owners are very friendly and do it all themselves (super impressive). You might wait a little bit, but im telling you it is soooo worth it! Also something i always notice is how CLEAN it is. Its seriously spotless which is something i appreciate. I haven't tried one thing here that wasn't delicious. If you haven't tried this place yet, do yourself a favor and go!

Hidden gem! I just moved to this side of town and was looking for authentic Mexican food and found this place in the gas station. They make everything in front of you and honestly I haven't had Mexican food this good in years.

Ok i had to try this place from the reviews it was a no brainer. I had the carne asada burrito. Food was solid but it wasnt the best i have ever had. It was good.I just moved here from los angeles and have been eating mexican food my whole life so all i can say is that in this town that there seems to be a shortage of quality food places and thats why people get blown away whenever something decent comes along. dont get me wrong this place was solid..fresh tortillas,lots of meat good quality meat too. The only thing i would say is that there is only 1 man working there i presume he is the owner,but I mean come on YOU NEED HELP...you cant do it all yourself it's not efficient for you or the customers. Im assuming he does this either because he is looking for help or he doesent want to pay for help.In any event he could definitely increase his sales with some assistance.Otherwise a solid choice for mexican food.

Don't pass it up just because it's in a gas station!! The prices are great and the food was awesome! 

We tried a big variety of things on the menu - all of them were delicious! Loved their namesake chile verde burritio, California burrito (carne asada was delish - hardly any gristle), crunchy shredded beef tacos with beans (combo #2). Mild (green) salsa was flavorful and delicious, hot (red) salsa was SPICY (sweat it out, kids!)

Had one (super friendly) guy doing everything - he took our orders and promptly busted out our six dishes... By himself! The one man show, everyone! For working by himself, everything came out super quick and he didn't forget any items. AWESOME.

Chile Verde has ruined me!  I can't be happy with Cafe Rio, Qdoba, etc.  This guy is amazing, he makes all his chips and shells from scratch!  I am not a person that has ever gone to a gas station to eat and now I am here at least once a week!  Everything is awesome, Chicken taquitos, chimichunga, taco salads, tacos, nachos.  I honestly think there is not a thing that isn't great on the menu!  Every time I go I try something new and am never disappointed.  When he is cooking the meat you can also have him fry up some peppers and onions, yummy!  I LOVE spicy and hot salsa and his red sauce is no joke!  It is clean and there is space to eat there.  He is working hard and sometimes there is quite a wait but oh so worth it!

First, let me just say that the food here is delicious. I come here weekly and can't get enough of their California burritos. Their tacos are great as well. You wouldn't think so because it's in a gas station, but you're in for a surprise. 

So why the less than stellar review? Well, there's a few things. 

There are only 8 or so stools to sit on. 5 in the front and 3 in the back. I guess it being in a gas station they prefer you to take your food and go. Don't plan on bringing in the family and having a comfortable sit down dinner. It ain't gonna happen. 

It's a one man show. Expect to wait 15 to 20 minutes for your order during the lunch rush. On two occasions I've seen a lady working with the only guy there. This was out of the 10 or so visits I've had. 

The hours are misleading. Please do yourself a favor and CALL before coming here. I came in at 6:15 only to realize that he closed when he was supposed to close at 8. This isn't the first time this has happened. I even called earlier at 12 and I was told they'd close at 8. It's a good thing I live nearby or else I'd be furious. 

My last gripe about the place is that the guy, or the both of them if the lady is working, will literally stop taking orders if they have a big order to fill. This, unfortunately, is not uncommon. There's a police station right across the street and the officers are big fans of the place. You'll see them carrying bags of orders from time to time. 

If it weren't for the amazing food with very reasonable prices, I would not bother coming here. Next time you're heading south on Rainbow off the 215, take the extra 3 minutes and drive past Chipotle and Roberto's/Don Tortaco and give Chile Verde Express a try. You'll be glad you did. Just make sure to phone your order.

Honestly anything you order here is delicious! Recently I've been on a breakfast kick and their breakfast burritos are so good! We get them about 3 times a week and they are consistently amazing every time. My favorite thing is that they use fresh eggs. Not many places, especially at a gas station, use freshly cracked eggs and it's what keeps me coming back. The chef is so efficient and great at what he does. Be ready for a little bit of a wait, he's the only one working most of the time and there are always people here, but trust me it's worth it! My other favorite is the chimichanga chicken burrito and of course you could never go wrong with carne asada fries! Be sure to check this place out, it's so delicious!!

I always get the chicken tacos, they have the best chicken tacos in LV. I have been going here for years and always tell my friends how great it is. Maybe the fact that it's in a gas station and you're expectations aren't high has something to do with it. This place a true surprise and a great spot to add to your frequent list. 

There are a few gripes, a woman works there once in awhile as the cashier and isn't the friendliest. In fact she looks like she hates life. Another would be calling in the order and the order not being cooked until you get there, which is kind of a hassle. The only reason you call in is to expedite the process. This doesn't happen everytime maybe 25% of the time.

However, the good definetly outweighs the bad. Therefore I rounded up, if I could I would give this a 4.5.

$4.99 large delicious machaca breakfast burrito. What's not to love?

Obviously others agree, because this spot has a steady stream of business despite being tucked away inside the Sinclair gas station convenience store.

Don't let the location and lack of an outside sign deter you: you want to eat here!

This place is top 3 best places in vegas, it was one guy cooking and taking orders did it all in a timely manner. He washed his hands everytime after handles cash. Very clean.
